snippet: The shift reflects analyses of a series of electronic “handshakes” between the missing Flight 370 and a satellite in the hours after the Boeing 777-200 vanished.
abstract: Australia plans to resume searching for Malaysia Airlines' missing Flight 370, abandoning area that had been the focus of the investigation and returning instead to examine the seafloor in area of the Indian Ocean where only the surface was checked.

byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The shift reflects analyses of a series of electronic “handshakes” between the missing Flight 370 and a satellite in the hours after the Boeing 777-200 vanished.

headline.main: Search for Missing Malaysia Airlines Jet to Move Southwest, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Australia to Revisit Area of Indian Ocean in Search for Missing Jet
